title: Taco Bell customers are freaking out as the chain cuts beef from the menu in some locations because of quality concerns
text:
Taco Bell pulled beef from locations in at least three states over the weekend, saying that the meat fell short of the chain's quality standards.

Customers on social media expressed anger and annoyance at the lack of beef at Taco Bell locations.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Some Taco Bell customers seeking a beef Crunchwrap Supreme or Beefy Fritos burrito over the weekend walked away from the fast-food chain disappointed.

On Saturday, Taco Bell told some restaurants to stop serving seasoned beef that did not meet its quality standards. The Associated Press, which first reported the news, said that locations in Michigan, Kentucky, Ohio, and elsewhere were forced to stop serving beef as the chain replenished supplies.

Read more: We asked more than 3,000 people about which fast-food chains have the best food, and Chick-fil-A dominated

Upset after arriving at Taco Bell and discovering that there was no beef to be found, some people complained on social media.

"THIS TIME I GO TO TACO BELL THEY ARE OUT OF BEEF AND CHICKEN. WTF?!? 'BUT WE DO HAVE VEGETARIAN OPTIONS' WTF DO I LOOK LIKE F---ING VEGISTABLES ARENT GOING TO SUSTAIN MY FIGURE," one angry tweet said.

Complaints about the lack of beef at some Taco Bell locations continued into Sunday evening.

—Jason Michael Moorer Howard (@Jmic84) October 13, 2019

"While some Taco Bell restaurants in the eastern Midwest and Northeast regions may be experiencing a shortage of seasoned beef, we are working diligently to replenish the supply in those restaurants and encourage fans to try any of our other delicious proteins like shredded chicken or steak in the meantime," a Taco Bell representative said in a statement. "We apologize for any inconvenience this might cause and appreciate our customers' patience."
description: Taco Bell pulled beef from locations in at least three states this weekend, saying that the meat fell short of the chain's quality standards.
